page.title: 04 The Pub at Radcot
page.content: The Swan Inn, by the River Thames and Radcot bridges, is the only place in the area for the locals to enjoy a drink, or play a game of darts, dominoes or shove halfpenny.The regular customers are not only from Radcot but also from the surrounding villages and the town of Faringdon. It is very popular in the summer months with holidaymakers who are boating or fishing or caravanning in the area. It is also popular with the tourist because food is available at the pub.There is an attractive riverside garden, so that families can enjoy themselves watching the river traffic whilst eating and drinking. In the grounds is the old stone shed originally built for the operator of the toll gates on Pidnell Bridge.
